But if you use this feature, then you are relying on some external mechanism to pay for the op, and you should bett‚Ä¶ https://t.co/vf9Je6o7e7
The "paymaster" feature allows paymaster contracts, which let you separate "who pays for the op" and "who sends the op".
All this ensures that if an op gets broadcasted through the mempool, then it is guaranteed that that op can get inc‚Ä¶ https://t.co/C6v1fCNlj4

ERC-4337, and its predecessor EIP-2938, do this by enshrining a split between "validation" and "execution".

The va‚Ä¶ https://t.co/mKiiAIUUzJ
Doing this securely requires a mempool node to be able to determine whether or not a given op is guaranteed to pay‚Ä¶ https://t.co/gYrRTsZZsz
This is the gold standard that the existing public mempool provides. And we absolutely need to provide the same gua‚Ä¶ https://t.co/RvteG32wVK
